intro: Agalmyla glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular agalmyla, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a perennial herb characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its botanical features include a basal rosette of leaves and a flowering stem that bears clusters of tiny blooms. Agalmyla glandulosa is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptability to dry conditions.
